definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: He soaked himself in the subject before daring to write about it.
sentences.chinese: 他悉心研究這個題目之後纔敢下筆寫。

sentences.english: But when I feel relaxed, my writing flows quickly and easily.
sentences.chinese: 但是我放鬆時，會感到下筆流暢自如。

sentences.english: He owns a gifted pen, who reads tremendously.
sentences.chinese: 讀書破萬卷，下筆如有神。

sentences.english: Break rolls of reading, writing if there is God.
sentences.chinese: 讀書破萬卷，下筆如有神。

sentences.english: I began Chinese writing in earnest in November 1983.
sentences.chinese: 一九八三年十一月，我開始熱心地以中文下筆。

sentences.english: A thousand words from the pen in a stream, but ten thousand li away from the subject.
I've always found the more I care about something, the harder it is to wrtie.
sentences.chinese: 我發現自己越在乎的事，就越不容易下筆。

sentences.english: And so, how does my experience inform the books I've written?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，我的生活經歷如何引導我下筆寫出這些書稿？

sentences.english: So, I don't know how to draw it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我不知道該如何下筆。

definition: to put pen to paper/pen mark
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to take up one's pen/to start to write
